channel.title: Super Nova (Death of a Star) Visible From Earth For 10 Nights
channel.description:
I don't know about the other side of the planet, but in the UK you'll be able to see the death of a star in the night, for 10 nights.
Pretty much a once in a life time opportunity, I'll try and find some better information but here's this: http://www.ibtimes.com/articles/204928/20110827/supernova-of-a-generation-brightest-exploding-star-in-40-years-spotted-astronomers-berkeley-closest.htm

related

also old, this happened 21 million years ago

item.source: Super Nova (Death of a Star) Visible From Earth For 10 Nights

item.title: Super Nova (Death of a Star) Visible From Earth For 10 Nights
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

[quote=“Jamie1200, post:7, topic:413783”][quote author=Andrew Ferguson link=topic=515752.msg3741545#msg3741545 date=1315408819]

I think things like that are the most beautiful thing in the world.

Destruction?? Well that’s one way to look at things.

It’s not destruction, is the end of the cycle that is always repeating itself. Stars take a few hundred billion years to expload.
[/quote]
Not explode, Supernovas aren’t explosions (Nova means new in Latin). When the supernova has finished it will become a neutron star.
OR
It can become completely unstable (collapse) and become a black hole :)[/quote]
I hope it becomes a white dwarf. =D

Read full topic

I think things like that are the most beautiful thing in the world.

Destruction?? Well that’s one way to look at things.
[/quote]
It’s not destruction, is the end of the cycle that is always repeating itself. Stars take a few hundred billion years to expload.[/quote]
Not explode, Supernovas aren’t explosions (Nova means new in Latin). When the supernova has finished it will become a neutron star.
OR

item.title: Super Nova (Death of a Star) Visible From Earth For 10 Nights
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

Something like this happened in like 1997, thought it was going to be like the size of the moon but it was really just like 2 times the size of a regular star. Thank god the radiation is at a safe distance or we would all be dead.

Read full topic
